* Gloeochaete }} The 'glaucophytes', also known as 'glaucocystophytes' or
  'glaucocystids', are a small group of freshwater microscopic algae. Together with the red algae (Rhodophyta) and green algae
  plus land plants (Viridiplantae or Chloroplastida), they form the
  Archaeplastida. However, the relationships between the red algae, green algae
  and glaucophytes are unclear, in large part due to
  limited study of the glaucophytes.

The glaucophytes are of interest to biologists studying the development of
chloroplasts because some studies suggest that they may be similar to the
original alga type that led to green plants and red algae.
